Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery chalice; yellowish cream slip; interior: glazed black with two bands in added white above double guilloche pattern in added red and white; exterior: guilloche band above broad black band and reserved area on which is a pre-firing inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The pattern decoration in the handle zone and on the interior surface are typical of both the Animal Chalice and Grand Styles.
An unusual position for a bespoke dedication.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 165, no. 27)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 736, no. 966)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33-4, no. 11, no. 49, pl. XVII)
Bourriau 1981 / Umm el-Ga'ab: Pottery from the Nile Valley Before the Arab Conquest (p. 83-4, no.162cl)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0670) (phase 2)
